name: Indefinite Madness
description: Indefinite madness lasts until cured. A Greater Restoration spell or more powerful magic is required to cure indefinite madness.
curedBy: Any effect that specifically cures indefinite madness

table.effect: 'Being drunk keeps me sane.' The character gains a new flaw: they become dependent on alcohol or another intoxicant.
'I keep whatever I find.' The character gains a new flaw: compulsive hoarding. The character refuses to part with possessions, no matter how worthless.
'I try to become more like someone else I know -- adopting their style of dress, mannerisms, and name.' The character gains a new flaw: identity displacement.
'I must bend the truth, exaggerate, or outright lie to be interesting to other people.' The character gains a new flaw: compulsive lying.
'Achieving my goal is the only thing of interest to me, and I'll ignore everything else to pursue it.' The character gains a new flaw: obsessive fixation on a single goal.
'I find it hard to care about anything that goes on around me.' The character gains a new flaw: apathy and emotional detachment.
'I don't like the way people judge me all the time.' The character gains a new flaw: intense suspicion and paranoia toward others.
'I am the smartest, wisest, strongest, fastest, and most beautiful person I know.' The character gains a new flaw: narcissism and delusions of grandeur.
'I am convinced that powerful enemies are hunting me, and their agents are everywhere I go. I am sure they're watching me all the time.' The character gains a new flaw: persecution complex.
'There's only one person I can trust. And only I can see this special friend.' The character gains a new flaw: an imaginary companion that they believe is real.
'I can't take anything seriously. The more serious the situation, the funnier I find it.' The character gains a new flaw: inappropriate humor as a coping mechanism.
'I've discovered that I really like killing people.' The character gains a new flaw: homicidal urges that must be actively suppressed.
